meanings.definition: It was behooved upon him to finish his homework before going out to play.
meanings.sent1: He knew it behooved him to study hard for the test.
meanings.sent2: It always behooved her to listen to her parents' advice.
meanings.sent3: It was quite behooved of him to forget his lunch at home.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility behooved him like a heavy cloak.
meanings.sent5: The importance of the task behooved him to focus all his energy on it.

meanings.definition: It behooved her to apologize for her mistake.
meanings.sent1: She felt it behooved her to make things right with her friend.
meanings.sent2: It often behooved him to admit when he was wrong.
meanings.sent3: It was rather behooved of her to trip over her own feet.
meanings.sent4: The weight of guilt behooved her to seek forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The sincerity in her apology behooved her to be forgiven.

meanings.definition: It behooved them to work together to solve the problem.
meanings.sent1: Teamwork behooved them to achieve their common goal.
meanings.sent2: It always behooved them to put aside their differences for the greater good.
meanings.sent3: It was somewhat behooved of them to argue over such a trivial matter.
meanings.sent4: The urgency of the situation behooved them to set aside their egos.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project behooved them to collaborate effectively.
